critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving the Plumbing Contracting Chapter of the Code of Fair Competition for the Construction Industry, under the authority of the National Industrial Recovery Act. It reflects the New Deal era's approach to economic regulation and government intervention in the economy. The document itself doesn't directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It centralizes power in the federal government through the administrator's oversight. The ideological tilt is liberal due to the interventionist economic policies.
